item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Sometimes people don't want to hear the truth because they don't want their illusions destroyed." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "When we are tired, we are attacked by ideas we conquered long ago." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Faith: not wanting to know what the truth is." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Man is the cruelest animal." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Neitzsche
item.description: "Every deep thinker is more afraid of being understood than of being misunderstood." -- Friedrich Neitzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Be careful, lest in casting out your demon you exorcise the best thing in you." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The higher we soar the smaller we appear to those who cannot fly." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "A thinker sees his own actions as experiments and questions--as attempts to find out something. Success and failure are for him answers above all." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Ah, women. They make the highs higher and the lows more frequent." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Soren Kierkegaard
item.description: "What labels me, negates me." -- Soren Kierkegaard

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Nietzsche
item.description: "That which is done out of love is always beyond good and evil." -- Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
item.description: "There are two different types of people in the world, those who want to know, and those who want to believe." -- Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "All things are subject to interpretation. Whichever interpretation prevails at a given time is a function of power and not truth." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Perhaps I know best why it is man alone who laughs; he alone suffers so deeply that he had to invent laughter." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Doubt as sin. — Christianity has done its utmost to close the circle and declared even doubt to be sin. One is supposed to be cast into belief without reason, by a miracle, and from then on to swim in it as in the brightest and least ambiguous of elements: even a glance towards land, even the thought that one perhaps exists for something else as well as swimming, even the slightest impulse of our amphibious nature — is sin! And notice that all this means that the foundation of belief and all reflection on its origin is likewise excluded as sinful. What is wanted are blindness and intoxication and an eternal song over the waves in which reason has drowned." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Today as always, men fall into two groups: slaves and free men. Whoever does not have two-thirds of his day for himself, is a slave, whatever he may be: a statesman, a businessman, an official, or a scholar." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "To predict the behavior of ordinary people in advance, you only have to assume that they will always try to escape a disagreeable situation with the smallest possible expenditure of intelligence." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Remorse.-- Never yield to remorse, but at once tell yourself: remorse would simply mean adding to the first act of stupidity a second." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
item.description: "I know of no better life purpose than to perish in attempting the great and the impossible." -- Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The lonely one offers his hand too quickly to whomever he encounters." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
item.description: "Silence is worse; all truths that are kept silent become poisonous." -- Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Nietzsche, Friedrich
item.description: "Love is a state in which a man sees things most decidedly as they are not." -- Nietzsche, Friedrich

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Distrust all in whom the impulse to punish is powerful." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Become who you are!" -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Fredrich Nietzsche
item.description: "I assess the power of a will by how much resistance, pain, torture it endures and knows how to turn to its advantage" -- Fredrich Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Everything the State says is a lie, and everything it has it has stolen." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "I am a forest, and a night of dark trees: but he who is not afraid of my darkness, will find banks full of roses under my cypresses." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "In Christianity neither morality nor religion come into contact with reality at any point." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Crispin add a quote by Fredrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Nothing on earth consumes a man more quickly than the passion of resentment." -- Fredrich Nietzsche
